text: Pilots from Altus AFB and Vance AFB flew over Tulsa yesterday and will be flying over Oklahoma City this morning in a show of support for our healthcare workers and essential employees. Post your photos and video of the flyover. #AirForceSalutes #MobilitysHometown #VanceProud

As churches begin to reopen later this week in Oklahoma, I hope you will join Kay and me in continued prayer for Oklahoma and our nation. These are difficult times, but I know our faith in the Lord will get us through them.

Last week, Congress passed and President Trump signed the CARES Act 2.0. This vital legislation will fully replenish funds for the Paycheck Protection Program and allow struggling small businesses to keep workers on payroll. It also provides an additional $100 billion in funding for health care providers as they continue to combat COVID-19.

As I have said before, we are fortunate to have President Trump leading our nation during a national crisis of this proportion. Our campaign will continue to support our President and I hope you will join us.

President Trump is doing a great job leading our nation during this national crisis, but we must continue to ask the Lord for wisdom and strength. Please join Kay and me in continuing to pray for Oklahoma and the United States.
We are fortunate to have a leader like President Donald Trump during these difficult times. The President is doing a great job guiding Oklahoma and our nation through this crisis.

Last week, I led a letter with Senator Lankford thanking President Trump's administration for ensuring coronavirus aid is available to businesses and nonprofits with faith missions. I applaud President Trump for making sure no faith-based entity is denied relief because of their religious values.
Thank you for paying attention to Oklahoma's needs, President Trump!

Oklahoma's hospitals and medical providers needed immediate relief to deal with COVID-19 and the CARES Act I voted for is providing it. $489 million in aid has now been distributed to approximately 4,100 healthcare providers in Oklahoma.

So many lives were dramatically altered 25 years ago today. Kay and I will never forget the tragedy, pray for those we lost, and hope for those who survived. Today #weremember the Oklahoma City bombing.

The Paycheck Protection Program is helping businesses here in Oklahoma stay afloat and make payroll during these difficult times. Over $4 billion is helping more than 25,000 Oklahoma businesses right now. Democrats need to stop playing political games and act on President Trump's request for additional funds for this essential aid.

President Trump's request for additional funds for the Paycheck Protection Program is the right thing to do. Our small businesses and workers need relief. It is shameful that the Democrats are holding up this vital aid.

Reminder: Due to the ongoing crisis, the Treasury Department and Internal Revenue Service have extended the federal income tax filing deadline to July 15, 2020. More info is available at https://www.irs.gov/newsroom/tax-day-now-july-15-treasury-irs-extend-filing-deadline-and-federal-tax-payments-regardless-of-amount-owed.

President Trump understands the Second Amendment is one of Americans' most valued rights. I applaud his decision to deem firearm businesses essential. Even during this crisis, we must ensure law-abiding citizens are able to exercise their right to keep and bear arms.

Help is on the way for our small businesses in Oklahoma. The Paycheck Protection Program provides small businesses with loans to pay up to 8 weeks of payroll and other expenses.  And these loans are eligible to be FULLY FORGIVEN. I encourage all small business owners to learn more about this program at https://www.sba.gov/funding-programs/loans/coronavirus-relief-options/paycheck-protection-program-ppp.
He is risen! Happy Easter to all my brothers and sisters in Christ.

Today, let us remember the crucifixion of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ who died for our sins. Thank you Father for sacrificing your only son so the entire world can find eternal life. Have a blessed Good Friday.
I am wishing a Happy Passover to all our Jewish friends who are beginning celebrations this evening.

Today, I filed for reelection as Oklahoma’s United States Senator. We need to stay focused on what matters for Oklahoma and for America. That means having a senator who is looking out for families in our state—protecting our jobs and our families. We’ve been tested through these last few weeks, and we’re not through it yet. But I'm confident that we are on the right track, particularly with President Trump's leadership.  I’m going to keep doing what I’ve done consistently for the people of Oklahoma: deliver results for our state and make sure we are able to grow and thrive, whether that means helping local hospitals secure expedited FDA approval to get COVID-19 labs operational, looking out for our energy producers or making sure our men and women in uniform have what they need.  Taking care of our military is of particular importance since President Obama decreased military funding by 25% in just five years, dropping readiness levels to dangerous lows. President Trump is quickly reversing that, and I’m proud to work with him as Chairman of the Senate Armed Services Committee to rebuild our military.  We’ve made a lot of progress on the military and in the fight against the virus, but we still have a lot to do.

Our nation and government is working hard to combat the spread of the coronavirus. I encourage you all to continue praying. This is a great challenge, but it is one we will overcome together with the help of the Lord.

In addition to relief for our health care providers and small business, the CARES Act provides relief for our families as well. Thanks to the leadership of President Trump, help is on the way. More information on help for workers and unemployment can be found at oklahomaworks.gov/covid19/.
I know these are unusual and stressful times, but I also know our faith will get us through them. Happy Palm Sunday to all my brothers and sisters in Christ.

The CARES Act does more than provide resources to our hospitals and local governments to respond to the coronavirus. It extends a lifeline to our small businesses as well during these difficult economic times.  For more information about the SBA loan program, please visit sba.gov/funding-programs/loans/coronavirus-relief-options/paycheck-protection-program-ppp. Additional resources and information for Oklahoma businesses can be found at okcommerce.gov/covid19/.

I am grateful for President Trump's leadership during these difficult times. The legislation I voted for and he signed last week, the CARES Act, will provide critical resources to Oklahoma's hospitals, rural health clinics, and our veteran health care system as they manage increased demand.

We're facing a new adversary, but we will prevail against the coronavirus. The Senate relief package I voted for, and which President Trump signed into law, will get needed resources to Oklahoma. Help is on the way for our families, healthcare providers, and small businesses. Read my editorial and learn more about the relief package at the link below.
Today is National Doctors’ Day, and I’d like to thank all of our doctors, nurses, and first responders who are working around the clock during these difficult times. You are doing the Lord’s work.

Oklahoma has suffered an incredible loss. Dr. Coburn was a respected conservative voice, a principled leader, a fearless advocate for what was right and was resolute in his faith in Jesus Christ. I had the distinct honor of serving with him. Kay and I are praying for his wife, Carolyn, and his entire family in this painful time. His loss will be mourned in Oklahoma and throughout our nation.

On Wednesday, I voted for a comprehensive #COVID19 relief package that helps Oklahoma families, our health care system, and our small businesses. This vital legislation provides funding for the treatment of individuals with coronavirus, vaccine development, expanded testing, much needed loans for our small businesses, economic assistance for our families, and expanded unemployment benefits for those who have lost their jobs.

During these difficult times, we must continue asking God for wisdom and protection. I am proud of Oklahomans for coming together today in prayer. Please join Kay and me in praying for our state and our nation.

President Trump and I are working to get us out of this. Last Wednesday, I voted to prevent crushing Oklahoma small businesses with mandates and I plan to vote ‘yes’ on the big relief package next week. More here:
Join Kay and me as we ask God for wisdom, protection, and deliverance from this trial. Thank you President Trump for proclaiming today’s National Day of Prayer.

President Trump is doing a great job, and I appreciate all the actions he has taken to address the coronavirus pandemic. Today’s national emergency declaration is the right call and will expedite the roll out of resources to Oklahoma.  I also commend President Trump for declaring Sunday as a National Day of Prayer. That’s exactly what we should be doing: asking God to give us wisdom in our response, to protect us during this trial, and to end the spread of the virus. I hope you’ll join Kay and me as we pray together with the President and the nation.

Democrats in the Senate wouldn't even support legislation to protect babies who are born alive. If they gain control of the Senate and we lose the Presidency, they'll reshape the judiciary with radical liberals who support taxpayer funded abortion.  Under President Trump, we've confirmed 193 constitutional judges who respect the right to life. If you're a pro-life voter, President Trump and I are counting on your support this fall. Too much is at stake to sit this election out.

Democrats want to destroy everything that has made America great. Conservatives have to win this November, from Donald Trump, all the way down the ballot. But, we need your help. Will you help make sure we win in November by chipping in $5 or more today?

In Case You Missed It: Last week I announced my re-election bid to be your Senator.  With a close relationship with President Trump and as Chairman of the Senate Armed Services Committee, I'm now in the best position ever to help my fellow Oklahomans. We've been listening to Democrats try to destroy everything that has made America great. I'm running to stop them.

Last week President Trump made Oklahoma history with a record setting vote for an incumbent President. Now the President needs our support in November. Are you as fired up as I am to support President Trump this fall?

As we kick off our campaign for U.S. Senate in Oklahoma, I am honored to have the support of President Trump. Together, we’re going to Keep America Great, keep America strong, and defeat the socialists.

18 years after 9/11, the threat of Islamic terrorism is still real and growing. As Chairman of the Senate Armed Services committee, keeping Oklahomans safe continues to be my top priority.  An American presence in Africa is essential to combatting the growing terrorist threat on that continent. This is a fight we cannot afford to lose. Read my editorial in the Washington Post:

This morning I addressed the Republican Party of Tulsa County convention on how much we have accomplished under President Trump. Working with the President, we have created the strongest economy of my lifetime, passed the largest tax cut in 30 years, and rebuilt our military which was decimated under Obama. I'm looking forward to getting back to work the President to keep delivering wins for Oklahoma.
Team Inhofe volunteers are out at the Tulsa and OK County conventions this morning. Come say hello! You can volunteer for the campaign here: jiminhofe.com/volunteer.

I have made the decision to seek re-election to another term as your Senator from Oklahoma. Here’s why: Right now, our nation is at a crossroads. Three years into President Trump’s first term, we have reversed much of the devastation that eight years of Obama brought us.  ✅ We have created the best economy of my lifetime.  ✅ We are rebuilding our military to be the strongest fighting force in the world. ✅ We have confirmed record numbers of conservative judges to the bench - 193 to be exact - who will follow the Constitution - including Gorsuch and Kavanaugh. But the fight isn’t over yet.  The Democrats don’t just want to repeal our conservative policies, and they don’t just want to take us back to the Obama years. They want to enact their radical socialist agenda. The Green New Deal, a government takeover of the health care industry, the confirmation of judges who won’t defend the right to life. These are the things they want.  It’s not just wrong - it’s dangerous. I’m running to make sure we defeat them.
In Oklahoma, we honor our flag, support our troops, and stand for our National Anthem. Happy National Anthem Day!
Today I proudly cast a ballot in Oklahoma's Republican primary for my friend and our President Donald J. Trump.

As the Chairman of the Senate Armed Services Committee, it is a relief to finally have a President who shares my commitment to protecting national security and ensuring we have the strongest military possible. Working with President Trump, we are well on our way to undoing the damage Obama did to our military with his 25% cut to the military over a five year period.

Under the Obama administration, the Oklahoma economy and our nation suffered. Today, thanks to President Trump's leadership and the enactment of conservative policies I have long championed, we have built the strongest economy of my lifetime. More Americans are working than ever before and we have brought the unemployment rate down to record lows.

President Trump promised to appoint conservative judges to the bench, and he has delivered on that promise for the American people in a very big way. In the Senate, we have confirmed not just two great Supreme Court Justices - Justice Gorsuch and Justice Kavanaugh - but a total of 192 new constitutional judicial nominees since the President took office.

I commend President Trump for including funding for a new Tulsa VA hospital in his proposed budget. With Tulsa County being home to more than 38,000 veterans, this hospital would bring much needed services far closer to those who need them. Our veterans put their lives on the line for our nation, and we must do our absolute best when it comes to taking care of them.

As the Tulsa World notes, the cost of doing nothing with regard to the Tulsa-West Tulsa levee system is unacceptable. We simply cannot allow a catastrophic levee failure to endanger thousands of Oklahomans' homes and businesses. That is why I am continuing to push the Army Corps of Engineers timely authorization of modernization efforts and improvements to the levee system.

After President Trump's decisive strike against Soleimani in Iraq, Iran once again understands their actions have consequences. Many of my colleagues, however, voted to limit the President's authority and ability to defend our nation. Now that Iran understands they cannot act with impunity in the region, we should not be sending them a signal that we intend to tie our Commander in Chief's hands. President Trump has consistently acted within his constitutional authority, and his actions have made our nation safer. As your Senator, I will continue to oppose any actions that threaten our national security by limiting the President's ability to deal with foreign aggressors like Iran.

Burdensome federal regulations have long put U.S. based firearms and ammunition manufacturers at a disadvantage compared to overseas competitors.  Working with President Trump, today I am happy to say we have modernized many of those regulations and delivered yet another win for small businesses in America. The National Shooting Sports Foundation recently penned a letter on this important issue. Read it at the link below:

I have long advocated for closer ties between the United States and Israel. I am happy to say we finally have a President who shares that commitment. In 2019, I led a delegation to Israel to visit the new U.S. embassy in Jerusalem where we discussed our shared security goals with Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu. Under the leadership of President Trump, our relationship with Israel has never been stronger.

As a builder and developer in south Texas for 20 years, I know the border. I've seen firsthand how the crisis has gotten worse. Fortunately, we finally have a president who is committed to addressing the issue of illegal immigration. In the Senate, I have championed  legislation to fully fund President Trump's border wall and end immigration loopholes like the practice of "catch and release" and sanctuary cities.

Three years ago today, President Trump had his first signing ceremony at the White House - and it was for my bill. It was a Congressional Review Act resolution that repealed an Obama-era regulation that harmed our oil and gas producers. Since the President's enactment of this resolution, we have seen unprecedented growth in our energy industry, and it has created more jobs, more affordable energy, more jobs, and helped pave the way to energy independence.

Obama's war on fossil fuels was really a war on Oklahomans. 1 in 5 jobs here are supported by our oil and gas industry. Since President Trump got elected, we won the war on fossil fuels, and now we are the largest oil and gas producer in the world. This is good news for everybody.  Domestic energy production is making us stronger on the international stage as well. When we can provide oil and gas to our allies abroad, it reduces the pressure they might otherwise feel from Russia or Iran. President Trump understands this - he understands the importance of Oklahoma and our energy sector to the nation. We are fortunate to have him in the White House.

After the flooding last year, we all know the Tulsa-West Tulsa levee system needs to be updated and modernized. I will continue to push the Army Corps of Engineers for timely consideration and authorization of this vital project. The levees are too important  to neglect-- they protect thousands of Oklahomans' homes and businesses.

Reducing burdensome regulations that choke our businesses and economy in Oklahoma has been a longstanding priority of mine, and I am proud to say we finally have a President who shares that priority. Under President Trump's leadership, we have repealed over 1,500 rules and created the best economy in decades because of it.  Between tax cuts and regulatory relief, the President has ushered in sustained economic growth that provides a stark contrast to the Obama years. Not only are we creating millions of jobs, we are lifting millions out of government assistance as well. In fact, since Trump was elected, the economy has grown such that 5 million people have come off of food stamps.

Oklahoma's farmers and ranchers, even the ones who are Democrats, understand that President Trump has been a champion for agriculture. With the signing of the Phase One trade deal with China, which will increase American agricultural exports by $32 billion, the President's approval rating among farmers is at a record high of 83%. Every Democrat running for President, on the other hand, is proposing regulations that would hurt Oklahoma's farmers and ranchers and put many out of them out of business. Like Obama, they want more federal control over their lands. We cannot allow that to happen. It is just one more reason why I am proud to support President Trump and will be working tirelessly for his re-election.

Reforming America's tax code and providing a massive tax cut were major priorities for President Trump and me. The Tax Cuts and Jobs act, which I voted for, provided not only the biggest tax cut for Oklahomans in a generation, it has powered the unprecedented economic growth we have seen since the President took office.  Now, household income is at the highest level ever, increasing over 6% since President Trump was elected. Unlike the Obama administration, President Trump is committed to ensuring Oklahomans keep more of their hard earned money - a commitment I proudly share.

Modernizing America's nuclear arsenal is a matter of national security, and President Trump and I share a commitment to getting it done. As long as there are nuclear weapons, we must possess an arsenal that can effectively deter any threat. As Russia and China continue to spend heavily on their nuclear capabilities, we cannot continue the Obama administration’s neglect of our aging arsenal continue. I commend President Trump for making this a priority, and, as the Chairman of the Armed Services Committee, I will continue to work with the President to ensure we have a policy in place that protects our national security and keeps Americans safe.

After months of the Democrats playing political games, I am pleased to say we have finally brought this impeachment trial to an end with the acquittal of President Trump. The fact of the matter is President Trump did not commit a crime or do anything wrong, and the whole process was entirely partisan from the start.  With this shameful saga behind us, I look forward to getting back to work with President Trump on the issues that matter to Oklahoma and America. Together, we have accomplished a lot in the last three years. We've built the strongest economy of my lifetime, rebuilt our military, and confirmed a record number of great judges. I am confident we will continue to build on those successes and accomplish a great deal more for Oklahomans and the American people.

As President Trump prepares to give his third State of the Union address this evening, America is in a much better place than it was three short years ago.  Under the President's leadership, we have appointed great conservatives judges to the bench, maintained economic growth that Obama deemed impossible, and strengthened our national security by rebuilding our military. The President has consistently delivered on the promises he made to Oklahomans and Americans, and our country is better off because of it.

Last Friday, I voted against the House impeachment managers' request for additional witnesses. President Trump did not a commit a crime or an impeachable offense, and calling additional witnesses will not change that fact.  Our job in the Senate is to evaluate the record the House sends over, and the truth is they failed to make a case against our President. I look forward to bringing this trial to an end soon and voting to acquit President Trump.

Under the Obama Administration, the EPA was weaponized against Oklahoma farmers, ranchers and agricultural communities. The Waters of the United States rule, in particular, granted federal bureaucrats sweeping authority to regulate virtually all waters throughout the county.  Thanks to President Trump and EPA Administrator Andrew Wheeler, we are now finalizing a replacement that will give states more flexibility to determine how best to manage waters within their borders. This is a win for all of our farmers and ranchers. Once again, the Trump Administration has lived up to its commitment to restore local control and end the era of regulatory overreach.

As Chairman of the Senate Armed Services Committee, I led the effort last year to improve housing on military installations by providing service members a "tenants bill of rights," additional funding for staff of on-site housing offices and more oversight by military officials of private contractors. Oklahoma is home to nearly 34,000 military personnel, and we must ensure all of these service members' housing is both high-quality and accountable.

The USMCA is a big win for Oklahoma farmers, businesses, and manufacturers, and I commend President Trump for signing it today. I agree with the President that Clinton’s NAFTA, which I voted against, was a disaster for workers. The USMCA will be a welcome replacement because it puts America and American workers first. Under this new agreement, our farmers and ranchers will have both free and fair access to North American markets. Moreover, it will allow us to continue building upon the historic job growth we have seen under the Trump administration. I look forward to continuing to work with the President to open up new markets, create more jobs, and level the playing field with our global competitors. Together, I have no doubt we will continue delivering wins for Oklahoma’s workers and families.

Last week, hundreds of pro-life Oklahomans and tens of thousands of pro-life Americans marched for life in Washington. While we've made progress advancing policies to protect the unborn, liberal states like New York and Vermont enact laws allowing abortion up to the moment of birth. The fight for life is nowhere near over. Together, we can overcome evil and affirm the dignity and inherent worth of every human being.

The Democrat impeachment managers should be ashamed for suggesting that a threat from President Trump is the only reason Republicans would vote against removing him from office. Nothing could be further from the truth. As each day of this saga drags on, the Democrats’ case gets weaker and weaker. President Trump has not committed any crime—period. That alone should have stopped the impeachment process in its tracks. After failing to make their case in the House, the reality is the Democrats want to string out this impeachment trial in an effort to damage President Trump's re-election. They know that the president has achieved so much—a great economy, constitutional judges and rebuilding the military. They know they need impeachment as a distraction from his record.

In the Senate, I am proud to work with President Trump on legislative efforts to grow our economy and rebuild our military. Together, we have delivered on those two key promises and the American people see it. As President Trump prepares to deliver his third State of the Union address, it's clear that our economy and national security are better today than under Obama.

The Susan B. Anthony List, one of our nation's foremost pro-life advocacy organizations, released its Congressional scorecard this week. I was honored to receive an "A" - their highest score - for my consistent pro-life voting record. I am proud to stand with millions of Oklahomans in support of life.

As thousands of pro-life Oklahomans and Americans prepare to rally in D.C. this week for the March for Life, I am proud to stand with them in the fight for the sanctity of human life. In the Senate, I have led the fight to prohibit discrimination by abortion against an unborn child on the basis of Down syndrome and co-sponsored vital pro-life legislation like the Life at Conception Act, the Born-Alive Abortion Survivor Protection Act and the Pain-Capable Unborn Child Protection. With 20 kids and grandkids, I am proudly pro-life and remain committed to restoring a government that recognizes our God given right to life.
Martin Luther King Jr. will forever be remembered for his commitment to advancing civil rights in our nation. Today, I hope you will join me in honoring his life and legacy.

As our closest ally in the Middle East, I have always advocated for stronger economic ties between the U.S. and Israel. One of our most recent partnerships will generate at least $20 billion in economic activity and help secure peace through strength of energy security in the region. I applaud this and hope more opportunities like this materialize in the future.

President Trump and I have accomplished a lot together over the last four years. We’ve rebuilt our military, secured American energy independence and confirmed over 150 conservative judges to the bench. Can we count on your support to continue advancing conservative policies for Oklahoma and the United States?

I opposed NAFTA in 1994 because it put Oklahoma workers at a disadvantage. Thanks to President Trump's leadership, we now have a fair agreement in the form of the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA), which will be a big win for Oklahoma truckers, manufacturers, and farmers. I am proud to stand with President Trump in support of the USMCA.

President Trump secured another major victory with the signing of a preliminary U.S. - China trade deal that will increase U.S. energy exports by $50 billion and U.S. agricultural exports by $32 billion all while keeping $370 billion in tariffs on Chinese goods to maintain leverage as trade talks continue. This deal is a major win for Oklahoma farmers, businesses and workers, and I applaud the President for working toward a good deal instead of a fast one.

In the 47 years since Roe v. Wade, abortion has deprived tens of millions of babies of a chance at life. I signed a letter with many of my fellow Oklahoma legislators asking the Supreme Court to overturn Roe and end the era of abortion-on-demand.  I am proudly pro-life and believe our Declaration on Independence guarantees every American the right to “life, liberty and the pursuit of happiness” – and that includes the unborn. I’ll always stand up for the unborn with an agenda that respects the sanctity of human life, advocating for the Life at Conception Act, the Born-Alive Survivor Protection Act, and the Pain-Capable Unborn Child Protection Act.  I’ll continue to work to defund Planned Parenthood and lead initiatives that promote adoption.

With the 2020 election in full swing, the Democrats are showing their true colors by proposing radical, socialist policies that will undermine America's prosperity under President Trump. Join my fight against socialism by adding your name now!

As I look back on this past year, I can't help but feel incredibly grateful for everything I've been blessed with. I want to wish all of Oklahoma a happy New Year, and I pray that God continues to bless America in 2020 and beyond.

We're close to our final fundraising deadline of 2019, and need your help to end the year with a bang! I'm working with President Trump to ensure that 2020 is our most successful yet. Help us by chipping in $20.19 (or more) now!
There are just a few days until the end of 2019, which means our final fundraising deadline of the year is also fast approaching. Help us close out the year strong by chipping in now!

On this day in 1945, Congress officially recognized the Pledge of Allegiance as our national pledge. May we always live up to it by working to remain "one nation under God, indivisible, with liberty and justice for all."

Not only are the Democrats pushing for a complete socialist takeover of healthcare, but they're trying to make taxpayers foot the bill for abortions in the process. I will continue standing with President Trump to protect the precious lives of the unborn.

One of the highlights of this year was being able to confirm a talented set of constitutional judicial nominees that President Trump appointed. In fact, just last week, we approved and sent 12 more district court nominees to a lifetime appointment on the federal bench, including two in Oklahoma.

As we gather with loved ones tomorrow, I pray we remember the true meaning of Christmas - celebrating the birth of our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ. And may we also remember those servicemen and women who can't celebrate with us. Merry Christmas!
To all of our Jewish friends and neighbors who are beginning to celebrate today, I wish you and your family a very Happy Hanukkah!

President Trump officially signed this year's National Defense Authorization Act! This bipartisan legislation protects our national security interests, provides our military men & women a pay raise, and establishes a new branch of the U.S. military, the U.S. Space Force! http://bit.ly/2EBYyia

I’m pleased Speaker Pelosi stopped delaying the USMCA and I look forward to the Senate considering it soon. When in full effect, it will boost our economy across key Oklahoma industries and expand opportunity for American workers. I'm thankful to President Trump for his leadership in negotiating this vital deal.

How has President Trump kept his promise to Make America Great Again? Since taking office, the U.S. economy has added more than 7 million new jobs. Plus, thanks to Republican tax cuts, Americans are experiencing higher wages. #GreatAgain
Democrats in the House voted to impeach President Trump after an unfair and baseless witch hunt. I'm standing by President Trump against the Left's sham. Join me by chipping in now!

During tonight's debate, we're going to hear even more of the Left's extreme agenda for America. If they are successful in 2020, it will mean a reversal of President Trump's accomplishments. Join my fight against the Left's radical agenda by adding your name now!

Every day we delay USMCA is a day that our farmers, ranchers, business owners, and families miss out on new prosperity and opportunity. This historic trade deal will create hundreds of thousands of jobs and provide a vital boost to our economy. Let's get it done!

Last week, the Senate confirmed President Trump's 50th circuit court judge! The president is reshaping U.S. courts for the better by appointing strong, constitutional judges. I'm thankful to him and proud to support these qualified nominees.

I'm very proud that my National Defense Authorization Act passed the House last week and is expected to pass the Senate this week. Not only does it provide a much-needed pay increase for our military men and women, but it also ensures a greater housing standard for military families. Read more:
I love riding in the Tulsa Christmas Parade, where we come together as a community to celebrate the birth of our Savior, Jesus. I joined the fun on Saturday and even bumped into my friend, Rep. Hern!

Today marks the anniversary of the ratification the bill of rights. These amendments to our U.S. Constitution guarantee many of the freedoms we hold dear such as freedom of speech, freedom of religion, and the right to keep and bear arms. As your Senator, protecting those freedoms will always be my highest priority.

Today is National Wreaths Across America Day where we remember our fallen U.S. veterans, honor those who serve, and teach our children the value of freedom. Learn more at https://www.wreathsacrossamerica.org/.
Today, I'd like to wish a very happy birthday to the U.S. National Guard. Thank you for being "Always Ready, Always There" since 1636!

Did you hear the BIG news? This year's National Defense Authorization Act will establish a new branch of the United States Armed Forces - The U.S. Space Force! A top priority of President Trump's, I made sure it was included in this year's NDAA so we can keep up with Russia and China in space.

Nearly 1 MILLION Oklahomans voted for President Trump in 2016. Now, less than 1 year away from a major election, House Democrats are rushing to impeach him because they are worried he will win again. That's not only wrong, it's an insult to voters.

President Trump promised to grow our economy and he has delivered on that promise with another round of record breaking jobs numbers released last week. Even the liberals who hate Trump can’t deny that "these are the best numbers of our lives" on jobs. Just another reason why I am proud to support the President for re-election in 2020. Together, we can Keep America Great! https://cnb.cx/2OYlLkG
